```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(sf)

library(spatstat)
library(maptools) 
library(sp)
library(raster)
library(tmap)
```

```{r}
# Read in the oil spill data
oil_spill <- read_sf(dsn = here("data"), 
                 layer = "Oil_Spill_Incident_Tracking_%5Bds394%5D") %>% 
  st_transform(crs = 4326) # Update CRS

# Plot it (exploratory)
plot(oil_spill)

# Get California counties outline
ca_county <- read_sf(dsn = here("data"), 
                    layer = "california_county_shape_file") %>% 
  dplyr::select(NAME) # Only keep one attribute (name) to simplify

# Set CRS
st_crs(ca_county) <- 4326 # Set CRS to match 

# plot them together
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = ca_county, 
          color = "darkorchid", 
          fill = "darkorchid4", 
          size = 1) +
  geom_sf(data = oil_spill, 
          color = "orange", 
          alpha = 0.7, 
          size = 2) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Make an exploratory interactive map in tmap showing the location of oil spill events included in the data. 


Make a finalized static chloropleth map in ggplot in which the fill color for each county depends on the count of inland oil spill events by county for the 2008 oil spill data
